examples: To be honest, I love visiting historical places.
To be honest, I find poetry very soothing.
To be honest, I haven't traveled much yet.

phrases.meaning: When you really want to do something
examples: I would love to visit Udaipur someday.
I would love to meet historians and writers.
I would love to explore ancient forts in Maharashtra.
I'm passionate about reading poetry.
I'm passionate about history and culture.

Visiting historical places inspires me a lot.
I can't recall the movie name right now.

I can't recall the author's name right now.

In my opinion, traveling helps you learn history better.

phrases.meaning: Used to compliment a good question and think before answering
examples: That's a great question — let me think for a second.
That's a great question, I would say history inspires me most.
That's a great question, and it's hard to answer immediately.

phrases.meaning: When you are unsure but want to say something
examples: If I'm not wrong, that fort is in Pune.
If I'm not wrong, Maharana Pratap fought in Haldighati.
If I'm not wrong, the movie released last year.

phrases.meaning: When you share information you're mostly sure about
examples: As far as I know, Udaipur is a beautiful city.
As far as I know, the battle was very intense.
As far as I know, that temple is ancient.

phrases.phrase: Let me put it this way
phrases.meaning: Used to explain something more clearly
examples: Let me put it this way — history shapes our future.
Let me put it this way — poetry heals emotions.
Let me put it this way — traveling teaches you lessons.

phrases.phrase: At the end of the day
examples: At the end of the day, hard work always wins.

At the end of the day, dreams push us forward.

phrases.meaning: When giving a balanced or honest opinion
examples: To be fair, both sides were brave in the battle.

phrases.phrase: Off the top of my head
examples: Off the top of my head, I think the movie was released in 2022.

Off the top of my head, I'd say history is my favorite subject.
